metadata.title: CVE-2024-38543 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:lib/test_hmm.c: handle src_pfns and dst_pfns allocation failure Thekcalloc() in dmirror_device_evict_chunk() will return null if the physicalmemory has run out. As a result, if src_pfns or dst_pfns is dereferenced,the null pointer dereference bug will happen. Moreover, the device is goingaway. If the kcalloc() fails, the pages mapping a chunk could not beevicted. So add a __GFP_NOFAIL flag in kcalloc(). Finally, as there is noneed to have physically contiguous memory, Switch kcalloc() to kvcalloc()in order to avoid failing allocations.

criterions.comment: linux package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-laptop package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-lowlatency package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-oracle package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-raspi package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-starfive package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
